text1_medium.title: Prayer for Children
text1_medium.author: William Cowper
lines: Gracious Lord, our children see,
By Thy mercy we are free;
But shall these, alas! remain
Subjects still of Satan's reign?
Israel's young ones, when of old
Pharaoh threaten'd to withhold,
Then Thy messenger said, "No;
Let the children also go!"
When the angel of the Lord,
Drawing forth his dreadful sword,
Slew with an avenging hand,
All the first-born of the land;
Then Thy people's door he pass'd,
Where the bloody sign was placed:
Hear us, now, upon our knees,
Plead the blood of Christ for these!

text2_short.title: Cancelled Passage of Mont Blanc
text2_short.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
lines: There is a voice, not understood by all,
Sent from these desert-caves. It is the roar
Of the rent ice-cliff which the sunbeams call,
Plunging into the vale--it is the blast
Descending on the pines--the torrents pour...

text3_short.title: His Heart was darker than the starless night
text3_short.author: Emily Dickinson
lines: His Heart was darker than the starless night
For that there is a morn
But in this black Receptacle
Can be no Bode of Dawn

text4_medium.title: Nature affects to be sedate
text4_medium.author: Emily Dickinson
lines: Nature affects to be sedate
Upon occasion, grand
But let our observation shut
Her practices extend
To Necromancy and the Trades
Remote to understand
Behold our spacious Citizen
Unto a Juggler turned --

text5_short.title: The Mountain sat upon the Plain
text5_short.author: Emily Dickinson
lines: The Mountain sat upon the Plain
In his tremendous Chair --
His observation omnifold,
His inquest, everywhere --
The Seasons played around his knees
Like Children round a sire --
Grandfather of the Days is He
Of Dawn, the Ancestor --

help_general: 1. Show help with longer explanations of options
2. Open menu to choose what type of text to generate
3. Load text from file given the path as an input
4. Paraphrase the given text (change or add words while keeping the context)
Press 2 or 4 to get more information on this options
Press any other key to continue
help_generate_text: 1. Search for a song by entering its author name and the title(only english lyrics can be paraphrased)
2. Generate random poem from Poetry DB database
help_paraphrase: Changed or added words will be highlighted in green.
1. Switch rhymes to matching ones while trying to maintain meaning of the original word
3. Add fitting adjective to describe the nouns
Press 1 to get more information on words to modify menu
Press any other key to continue
help_words_to_modify: If a word is less than 4 characters or is not in the database it will stay unchanged
1. Modify last word in every verse
2. Modify first word in every verse
3. Modify random word in every verse
4. Modify every word in every verse (takes a lot of time)
Press 1 to get more information on accuracy menu
Press any other key to continue
help_accuracy: 1. High chance the phrase will keep its meaning, paraphrase will stay the same for the same input
2. Medium chance the phrase will keep its meaning, paraphrase may stay the same for the same input
3. Low chance the phrase will keep its meaning, paraphrase should not stay the same for the same input
4. Go back to choosing which word in a verse to modify
